Decision.Text: If you want to find out more about the promised “this and that,”
If you’d rather not demonstrate distrust of Colonel’s men
Now you can continue with an easy mind
Yes! (You’re aware already that cheating gets punished, so be careful. Choose this option only if you really know what you’re doing.)
No. (Way to go. Better clueless but sincere.)
If you were planning to use the Black Box your boat should be equipped with (which is precisely what it’s for, after all)
Otherwise, make sure you cross out all your Fate Coins (if you still have any left).
Or keep it for a more critical situation
If you suspect him of the sabotage
If you look for another explanation
Or landing on the rear slope and a crafty on-foot foray
Or you’ll land where it blasted off from

Chance.Text: Tails: your tail between your legs
Heads: head for the nice option

Decision.Text: You and Willy head right; Betty moves left
You and Betty head right; Willy, left
You move left; Betty and Willy, right

Condition.Text: That would be stretching truth to the point of breaking

Decision.Text: A suicidal attack relying on the surprise factor
You’ll strike out for the exit
Or rather, try to strike a better deal
If you believe the caller is none other than the Fly and want to warn Colonel about it
If you won’t bet on it
Read the contents of the file first
Willy, who suddenly pokes you ribs and whispers, “Boss, I’m the best, just lemme try”
Go all the way to the next section

Chance.Text: Tails: your tail between your legs
Heads: head for the nice option

Decision.Text: You’ll do a desperate maneuver, risking to crash the boat, in order to avoid the fatal clash
Or it’s already all the same to you
If you don’t mind subjecting Elizabeth to a cross-examination in order to wring out some info
If you think she’s not to blame
If you will flee for your lives
If you will shoot it with your blaster
If you will stay where you are, motionless
And lastly, if you just want to forget about the worm because you don’t like it
If you can swallow your disappointment about the missed encounter with the mythical beast, forget about the worm

Condition.Text: Go back to flip the coin again (-1 F.C.)

Decision.Text: Go back, you jerk you! (-1 F.C.)
Do not expect such a thing to happen again.
Check the enciclopedia what a Swong is
If you want to sit and order
If you think there’s something odd in his words
Or loaf around in the boat
If you’ve suddenly changed your mind and wish to personally kick out your dissipated crew into the hostile alien environment
If you’re a stranger to such excesses
You’ll scour the ancient town, which looks real enough
Or take up a convenient station and wait for something to show up on its own
‘Sevil the Fly’s ultramodern villa-bunker, rising among the ruins in the desert, weathered by ghostly winds
The ancient powerful monster buried beneath tons of sand and stone that guards the secrets of the abandoned town
Nothing; you are only killing time
If something in this section bothers you, you can first consult here
You’ll fight back, strictly within the bounds of unavoidable police self-defense
Or won’t run the risk of harming a colleague, whatever that may cost you
You’ll hem and haw, and go back to the boat, like you haven’t seen anything (Have you? Says who?)
You’ll growl and snarl, and leap at the opportunity to do, for a change, something for your mission, no matter how insanely dangerous
You’ll put the unwashed proletariat in his place
You’ll get back in the boat, wait a while longer and finally leave
Or scour the ancient city in a body, hoping that it’s at least partially real
If you meant to use the Combat Freezer which is part of your special equipment
If it’s the first time you hear of such a thing (be honest), you raise your blasters
If you want to see what all the fuss was about, go find the results of using the Freezer.
If you still prefer your old faithful blasters, go to the section, where you’ll find the sentence, “What’s this nonsense, Jerk?!”
You’ll storm the emerald fortress directly through its main entrance (Sic!)
Or look for a way to sneak inside and surprise ‘Sevil, say, in his bathroom (if the beast ever takes a bath, of course)
You’ll intervene to wring some info out of him
Or leave him to the expert (William)
You’ll sneak out before they’ve noticed you (begging the question where else you’ll go in the middle of the desert)
You’ll grit your teeth and risk joining the company of a serial killer
If you’re willing to take such a madcap risk
Otherwise, there’s nothing for it but to go back ignominiously
You’ll point out to the rival captain that ‘Sevil is your mission
Or keep mum submissively and instead ask him to give you a ride, being colleagues and whatnot, if you’re going his way, of course

You can go on defending your pride with more solid arguments (of the blaster variety). In case of success, you’ll gain Captain Cobretti’s ship, and the guys in Internal Investigations will at most sigh in relief to discover the most wayward cop in the galaxy pacified for good. All of that!
If you’d rather concentrate on the opportunity to extricate your crew from the situation (expropriating said ship on your way out)
And if you believe that your conversation may have veered in the wrong direction, but a little familiarity and camaraderie will set it straight
Informally, on a first name basis
You’ll turn on the hyperspace engine of the Dodge again, letting it take you elsewhere
You’ll stay in the Asteroid Belt, counting on your incredible piloting skills
Or you might possibly ... Hmm, it seems you need a few explanations.
If the sign has made you feel welcome enough
You’ll get up and wander around the bar, hoping to come across a new clue
Or finish your coffee and leave
You’ll pretend you were staring in space and will immediately engage Willy in conversation
Or politely meet the cyclops’ eye and address him in a most innocuous manner
You desperately crawl toward the exit
You’ll treat them to an arrival to remember
Or rein in your impish impulses
If you already have an idea
If you have an idea already
Get to know more about Technoworld
You can come up with a code on the spur of the moment
Or let your crew deal with the situation

Condition.Text: If you’re in Captain Cobretti’s craft, you can send its actual identification code

Decision.Text: Or leave ‘em alone and head for the parking lot

Condition.Text: You don't have the codeword “centipede,” so go back

Decision.Text: Get on your ship and head back for the center of the rally, dead set on meeting Hsying, and no less unstoppable
Or get on your ship and head somewhere far from mad Ajax and anything Ajax-related
At the engines of the terminator
Still, you’ll try to carry on with the conversation, explaining the delicate character of your confidential mission
In spite of everything, you’ll trust him
If you don’t intend to waste your valuable time with garbage, return for a more fruitful alternative
Or go back and put your time to better use.
If you choose to try and intimidate the Technoworld folks, given that they still don’t know who they’re dealing with
If you’d rather leave the decision to your crew
If you choose to imitate signal interference while dictating a false identification code, hoping to deceive the Technoworld folks
If you’d rather leave the decision to your crew
You can give up on Miami
Idle around a while longer and see what will happen
Or storm the satellite, one ship against the whole of Technoworld
Or stay where you are, hoping to impress them with your stubbornness
With a banking and flanking maneuver, keeping a safe distance from your millionfold larger adversary
Or through Technoworld itself, in the good kamikaze traditions
Dangerously close to the surface of the artificial planet, and then GAAAAS! to Miami, pursued by their fighters
You’ll leave William to put them in their place, while you keep out of their range with unpredictable turns
You’ll report on what’s brought you to Miami
Or keep it yourself and risk appearing as if you’ve been messing about rather than doing your job

Condition.Text: Yet if you stick to the truth, you are going to get into gravely discrediting and incriminating details
If you don’t feel like admitting that you’ve personally incinerated one of the Galaxy’s most efficient cops (and his partner), you can pretend you don’t know anything about their whereabouts
Yikes! If, in fact, it is not (but merely looks so)
If you admit who was the former owner of the ship

Decision.Text: Continue, fully deserving what awaits you
If you stick to the truth, you are going to get into gravely discrediting and incriminating details. Ready for that?
If you don’t feel like admitting that you’ve personally incinerated one of the Galaxy’s most efficient officers (along with his partner), you can say you don’t know anything
Continue, fully deserving what awaits you
If you believe such an occurrence is not as unthinkable as it appears to the colonel, and you want to let him in on your doubts
If you believe such an occurrence is not as unthinkable as it appears to the colonel, and you want to let him in on your doubts
If you believe that an act of great daring can persuade your unresponsive colleagues to give you access, take the risk
Otherwise, go back for another choice.
If you’ve forgotten about terminator ships or this is the first time you hear of them, perhaps you’ll change your mind and leave Ajax
If you’re hell bent on getting to Hsying, prepare yourself for the fight with the terminator ship blocking your way
If this whole thing smells like a trap to you, and you order a preemptive strike at it
And if such an act doesn’t quite fit your initial intention to help
You’ll zoom off in the opposite direction
Turn on the camouflage field of your ship and keep quiet
Or send an SOS yourself and keep moving
You slam the door shut, from the outside
You tip-toe your way to the opposite exit
Into elaborating on the First Law of Robotics
You’ll attack him at once, before he’s poisoned your mind and bent your will completely
You’ll take advantage of the makeshift weapon, brought to you, it would seem, by Fate herself
Or you’ll have none of that crock and keep relying on your trusty lightsaber
The news, though rather scanty at this stage, is troubling enough. What will be your response?
